title: There’s Still No Global Deal on Opioid Litigation, but Distributors Will Sit Out Monday Trial
text:
Four key defendants in the opioid litigation reached a last-minute deal to sit out of the key trial scheduled to begin Monday morning, according to The Wall Street Journal, but the hoped-for settlement to resolve the opioid litigation remains elusive.

Early Monday, The Wall Street Journal reported that drug distributors McKesson (ticker: MCK), Cardinal Health (CAH), AmerisourceBergen (ABC), and generic drugmaker Teva Pharmaceutical Industries (TEVA), had reached narrow agreements with the two Ohio counties that are the plaintiffs...
